item.title: Using GitHub to build a missing GitHub feature
item.description: After the Microsoft acquisition, GitHub has been on a roller coaster ride. It has been winning the developer communityâ€™s affinity by launching a series of offerings, one after another, starting from the free private repositories to the GitHub Sponsors program. Still, there are unmatched expectations that users have from the hub of open-source. This guide is about one such expectation, a feature that is missing from GitHub and my product-first approach to building that as a side-project.
